intro: Scutellaria humilis, commonly known as the common bluebell, is a low-growing perennial herb native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically reaches a height of 10–30 centimeters and features slender, branching stems covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are usually blue or violet in color, often arranged in whorls along the stem. Its leaves are opposite, ovate to lanceolate, and have a rough texture. Scutellaria humilis is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
